document.docAuthor: Câmara, Josenir T., Takiya, Daniela M., Plant, Adrian R. & Rafael, José A.
document.docTitle: Hemerodromia membranosa Câmara, Takiya, Plant & Rafael, 2015, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Neotropical Hemerodromia Meigen (Diptera: Empididae), a world of discovery II: New species from Atlantic forest, Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Neotropical Hemerodromia Meigen (Diptera: Empididae), a world of discovery II: New species from Atlantic forest, Brazil

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis . Similar to
H. longilamellata
. Phallus with membranous area covered with spicules and hook-like process apically (
Fig. 42
); ejaculatory and gonocoxal apodemes very long (
Figs 39, 40, 42
).

Type material
.
HOLOTYPE
♂, “ Brazil , CE[Ceará], Ubajara, P.[arque] N.[acional] Ubajara, Cachoeira do Cafundó.
03º 50 ' 13 ''S
–
40 º 54 ' 35 ''W
, Malaise,
20–22 .vii. 2012
. J.A.Rafael & F.Limeira-de-Oliveira” ( CZMA ).
Paratypes
: Same data as holotype (
5 ♂
, INPA ,
4 ♂
, CZMA ). Idem ,
13–17 .xi. 2012
. F. Limeira-de-Oliveira, D.W.A. Marques, cols. (
2 ♂
, MNWC ).
Etymology . From the Latin membranaceus, referring to the apical membranous area on the phallus.
Variation . Paratypes with body length varying from 2.1–3.5 mm and wing length varying from 1.2–1.8 mm .

Remarks .
Hemerodromia membranosa
sp. nov.
appears to belong to the same group of species that includes
H. lamellata
,
H. longilamellata
and
H. megalamellata
sp. nov.
, which share very long ejaculatory and gonocoxal apodemes.
Hemerodromia membranosa
sp. nov.
is similar to
H. longilamellata
by having the cercus pointed apically (
Fig. 39
) and epandrium rounded apically (
Fig. 39
).
Hemerodromia membranosa
sp. nov.
differs from
H. megalamellata
sp. nov.
by phallus with membranous area covered with spicules and hook-like process apically (
Fig. 42
). The phallus of
H. longilamellata
has a narrow membranous area apically and lacks scattered spicules (
Câmara et al ., 2014
, fig. 60 ).
